message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.LG, cs.HC 

This paper discusses the use of social network information in recommendation systems, which falls under the category of social network analysis. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses collaborative filtering and k-nn algorithms, which are commonly used in information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also touches on the topic of human-computer interaction (cs.HC) as it discusses the limitations of mobile devices. Finally, the paper discusses the non-random distribution of item preferences in social networks, which falls under the category of social computing (cs.SOC).
